newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: SAfrica aims for 5.1 pct deficit this year - Mandela.
newsitem.headline: SAfrica aims for 5.1 pct deficit this year - Mandela.

text.p: President Nelson Mandela said on Wednesday that South Africa was aiming for a budget deficit of 5.1 percent of gross domestic product this year and 4.0 percent in the next financial year.

"We want to keep the budget deficit at 5.1 percent this year and at four percent next year," Mandela said in a speech to businessmen. He said the government was trying to keep the budget below 200 billion rand.
It would be necessary for the government to keep spending down to achieve that figure.
